newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia manufacturing output up 12.8 pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia manufacturing output up 12.8 pct in 1996.

text.p: Malaysia's manufacturing output grew by an estimated 12.8 percent last year against 14.5 percent in 1995, the Minister for International Trade and Industry Rafidah Aziz said on Thursday.

The manufacturing sector contributed 34.5 percent to the country's gross domestic product in 1996 against 33.1 percent in the previous year, the minister said at an annual briefing for industrialists and diplomats.
Rafidah said investment in the manufacturing sector last year was 41.7 billion ringgit against 26.9 billion in 1995.
Malaysia's manufactured exports grew by a slower 5.8 percent against 22.9 percent in 1995, she said.
"The manufacturing sector was the lead growth sector followed by the construction and services sector," she said.

"The moderation in manufacturing output in 1996 was due to deceleration in the growth of some export oriented industries, particularly electronics, due to a softening of external demand," the minister said.
